thread.title: Melbourne plane crash: Five feared dead after light aircraft plunges into shopping centre
thread.title_full: Melbourne plane crash: Five feared dead after light aircraft plunges into shopping centre - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Melbourne plane crash: Five feared dead after light aircraft plunges into shopping centre
text:
Melbourne plane crash: Five feared dead after light aircraft plunges into shopping centre Dramatic images show a building badly damaged and in flames after the crash in Melbourne   Share   Comments By Steve Robson 22:52, 20 FEB 2017 Updated 23:11, 20 FEB 2017 News Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in  Aircraft 'crashes into shops' next to Melbourne's Essendon Airport   Share this video Watch Next   Share   Comments Get daily   At least five people are feared dead after a plane crashed into a shopping centre in Australia.
The light aircraft plunged into the building near Essenden Airport in Melbourne at around 9am local time.
The crash sent a huge ball of black smoke into the air which was visible for miles around.
Aerial pictures show major damage to the DFO shopping centre which was ablaze.
The retail centre opens at 10am so was closed to the public, but workers were likely to have been inside at the time.
Five people were on board the plane, according to reports.
It was suggested the plane was an air ambulance but Victoria Ambulance service later clarified this is not the case.
Victoria Police said: "At this stage we do not have information regarding possible casualties and police are currently evacuating the area."
The fire brigade advised motorists to avoid the area due to the smoke.
